title: Longmont Police Notes: Rock Throwing
maintext:
Longmont police officers took a report Thursday of a criminal mischief that occurred near the intersection of 9th Avenue and Tulip Street. An unknown suspect threw a rock at a vehicle. Due to the lack of further suspect information, the case will be closed.
Longmont officers responded to the 1100 block of Parker Drive on Thursday in reference to a report of criminal mischief. A 43-year-old man reported the tire of his vehicle was slashed. The case is closed.
Longmont police investigated a theft that occurred Thursday in the 900 block of Hover Street. The case is closed.
At about 9:45 p.m. Thursday , Longmont officers were dispatched to a call of a motorcycle theft in the 600 block of Longs Peak Avenue. The suspect has not been identified at this time, and the case is closed.
Longmont police responded to a theft that just occurred at about 11:30 p.m. Thursday in a parking lot of a closed business in the 500 block of Hover Street. A Longmont man had met an unknown person to sell an item and the unknown suspect stole the item without paying. The suspect fled in a vehicle that was later determined to have been stolen. There are leads in this matter and the case is open, under further investigation.
